question: If some people get a chance to choose between life without work in spending most of the time working, then they would choose not to work. Do you agree or disagree?
text: Nowadays, we are living in a world full of different questions that answering to them needs a severe cognition about the universe. Many people argue that if societies are given a chance to choose between working for their whole life and a life without any working, they would go for the second option. This essay is going to be written considering the agreement of the writer with the posed theory.

Initially, I believe human beings are lazy by their nature. This means, our instincts are trying to persuade us not to work hard if there is a way to achieve a goal without much effort. For instance, at the present time, it can be seen a growing tendency in young ones especially adolescence that they prefer to have revenue from playing video games rather than studying a course in the university and finding a job based on their degree. Hence, we have been inventing new methods in order to work less or at least in a more comfortable situation.

Moreover, all of us know that working is not equal to having a luxurious lifestyle. In other words, we are aware of the fact that says many people just can provide their basic needs with a full-time job. So, they cannot achieve all their dreams and targets just by working as hard as possible. To illustrate, most of our parents have worked eight hours a day, five days a week for 30 years and yet they do not even have a house for themselves.

To sum up, there is an assumption that claims humans prefer not to work at all if they have the chance and I believe this is a fact that cannot be considered wrong about humankind's nature. From my perspective, all of us have realized at some point in our lives that having a job, even a good one, is not going to be a magic wand that can make the impossible possible. As a result, signing a lifetime resignation seems to be a quite better offer to accept especially in a world like ours.
